name: Smooth modulations
description: Use a module like Random, RndC, Walk or Caudal to generate random slow movements.

name: Use a filter
description: Make something and alter the output with a filter module.

name: Bernoulli gates
description: Do something with bernoulli gates.

name: Modulate filter cutoff with sequencer
description: Use a sequencer on a filter cutoff to provide accenting or effects on a signal.

name: New oscillator
description: Use an oscillator module you have never used before.

name: Saturate something
description: Use Debriatus for the saturate knob.

name: Transpose a sequencer with a sequencer
description: Use a 2nd sequencer to transpose a sequence (on some of the steps; use a mix to combine the voltages from the 2 sequencers).

name: Mix in a random source to a step
description: Random note per step mix a random source. Use a VCA to control its amplitude before combined with main sequence.

name: Sequential switch
description: Add variation with a sequential switch.

name: Combine sequences with boolean logic
description: Use boolean logic on sequences. E.g. Feed two different sequence into an AND output.

name: Track-and-hold a sequence
description: Use a track-and-hold on a sequence (gate will cause it to stay at certain values).

name: Generate pitches from an LFO
description: Use a sample-and-hold on an LFO signal with a clocked gate to generate pitch sequences.

name: Mix sequence gates
description: Mix sequence gates to generate different voltages to make melodies.

name: Harmony from single sequence
description: Use a single sequence with sample-and-hold on different divisions gated each going to a different voice; get harmony from one sequence of notes.

name: Comparator to generate gates
description: Use compare module on sequence to generate gates only at certain times. e.g. above threshold goes to one voice and the below threshold goes to another voice

name: Slope detector from a sequence
description: Use Count Modula's Slope Detector from a sequencer generating CV values to trigger two different voices. (Rising triggers one, falling triggers the other)

name: Probably trigger a reset
description: Use Decima with varying probabilities on steps to trigger a reset on a sequence.

name: Convert triggers into gates
description: Use a module that converts a trigger into a gate.

name: Rhythm variations with Step Wave
description: Use Step Wave from CV Funk for rhythm variations in sequences.

name: Sequence variations with Turing machine
description: Use Slips, Turing machine or Permutation to make random sequences with optional variations with probability and also modulation variations.

name: Modulate parameters with polyphony LFO
description: Use Polycon on a polyphony osc and use LFOs with poly to modulate different parameters differently

name: Long clock divisions
description: Make different parts fade in and out by long clock divisions or counters (e.g. 32 bars or something)

name: Bernoulli rhythm
description: Make a rhythm with a bernoulli gate or chances.

name: Euclidean rhythms
description: Make a rhythm using a module that generates euclidean rhythms.

name: Probably irregular trigger
description: Use a clock divider clocked from an irregular trigger (triggered with probability).

name: Sample-and-hold to gate
description: Use a sample-and-hold module to trigger a voice (whenever it passes 1v it will be a gate).

name: Shift register to trigger
description: Use output from sample-and-hold into a shift register that triggers voices.

name: Probably rhythm
description: Use a sequencer with probability to generate a rhythm.

name: Irregular triggers with boolean logic
description: Use boolean logic to trigger a voice when two irregular triggers happen at the same time.

name: Comparator to trigger
description: Use a comparator to trigger when combination of two other triggers go above/below.

name: Transpose with sample-and-hold values
description: Mix a CV sequence with a sample-and-hold value to transpose it.

name: Bernoulli clock
description: Use a bernoulli gate where one side advances one sequence and the other side advances another sequence.

name: Sample-and-hold flip flop gates
description: Use a sample-and-hold on a flip flop module to generate random timed and sized gates.

name: Sidechain with inverted envelope
description: Use an inverted envelope to duck sounds down when a drum hit (or other) sound occurs.

name: Put effects before an envelope
description: Apply an envelope after an effect (e.g. reverb/delay) and control its output with an envelope.

name: Euclidean polyrhythm
description: Use two euclidean rhythm modules to create a polyrhythm for two voices.

name: Sample-and-hold at audio rates
description: Trigger a sample-and-hold at audio rates to get interesting effects on a signal.

name: Envelope on pitch information
description: Mix in a generated envelope on pitch information at certain steps to make trills and movements in the pitch.

name: Occasional effect
description: Use a divided clock trigger on a VCA bringing in a signal from an effect only at certain times.

name: Modulate a parameter anyway
description: Use (ÂµMAP) micro-map to modulate a parameter that doesn't have a CV input to control.

name: What the Rack?
description: Use 'What the Mod' to spawn in random modules and build a patch from what you get.

name: Modulated sample-and-hold feedback
description: Use a sample-and-hold module triggered by an LFO pulse wave, but modulate the LFO frequency by the output of the sample-and-hold.

name: Ring modulator
description: Use a ring modulator module to add an effect to a voice.

name: Frequency modulation
description: Build a voice utilizing frequency modulation.

name: Reverb into distortion
description: Make a big voice by passing the signal through reverb and then through distortion.

name: Send highs through delay
description: Send just the high frequencies from a voice to a delay module to get a cool effect.

name: Extract rhythm from complex modulation
description: Create a complex modulation with 2 LFOs feeding back on each other (FM) and use a comparator from that signal to clock another voice.

name: Just explore a plugin
description: Pick a random plugin collection and build something using its modules.

name: Audio rate sequence
description: Use a sequencer at audio rates to generate a oscillator.
